p: PL pro is another important druggable target due to its important functions in the viral replication cycle. This enzyme is involved in N-terminal viral polyproteins cleavage in order to generate many Nsps (Nsp1, Nsp2, and Nsp3) ( Mhatre et al., 2020). It is also crucial in alienating the innate immunity of the host cells. Indeed, SARS-CoV viruses use PL pro as an antagonist to inhibit the activation of the interferon regulatory factor-3 pathway (IRF3-pathway) in order to reduce the production of interferon widely known for its antiviral activities ( Chen et al., 2014; Yuan et al., 2015). For this, the inhibition of PL pro enzyme would normally elicit a robust interferon-mediated response, activate the immune system and the antiviral response of the host cells, and also disturb the replication cycle.
